intro: Cyrtandra punaluuensis, commonly known as the Punaluʻu cyrtandra, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian island of Molokaʻi. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its showy, tubular flowers that are typically pink or red in color. It thrives in moist, shaded environments, often found in montane rainforests. Due to habitat loss and introduced species, it is considered endangered and is protected under Hawaiian conservation efforts.
